Transcript:
Lucy: All right, I think that should be everything. I've got my tarot cards, 
incense, I've got my runes. Oh, yeah, I've got my collapsible stake.
Kevin: Where did you get a collapsible stake?

Lucy: Don't ask. All right, wait, my incantation book. Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah, 
there it is, and my crystals. Ok, I'm all set. Oh, an umbrella. It could rain.

Kevin: Lucy, we are not trotting off to some stranger's house at night in the 
middle of vampire country.

Lucy: This is not some stranger's house, this is my family, and it would be 
very, very rude to ignore the invitation.

Kevin: Oh, and exactly how do you know that they are family? I mean, this 
note wasn't even signed.

Lucy: But, Doc, this note had this seal on it. Now, this is the same symbol I 
saw on that necklace that Michael gave Eve, not to mention these words -- "I 
think it's time we finally meet."

Kevin: Uh-huh, not to mention we have no proof that you're even related to 
the Morleys.
Lucy: But we do not have any proof I'm not.

Kevin: Has it occurred to you that this could be a trick, Lucy? That the same 
person who sent that note might be the same person who just tried to kill you?

Lucy: Yeah, but it also occurred to me that the note could've been sent by 
that mysterious wonderful person who saved my life in the nick of time. I hate 
it when you get so darn logical.
Kevin: Oh, then you agree this is ludicrous and dangerous.

Lucy: What I agree on is, yes, maybe it is, but I have this. I have my bag of 
protection. If I sense any evil in or around that house, I'll be ready.

Kevin: Lucy, no. We're getting on a plane and we're leaving Transylvania 
tonight.

Lucy: Oh, Doc. I know you're trying to protect me, and I love you so very 
much for that, but please, Doc, I have to do this. This is my one chance to have 
all the questions about who I am and where I come from answered. I have to go 
through with it. Now, if you want to leave and go back to Livvie, I can 
understand that. I'm fine with that.
Kevin: That's a low blow, Lucy. You know I'd never do that.
Lucy: I know, and I love you for it and thanks for understanding.
Livvie: What are you going to do to me?
Michael: I'm not going to hurt you. Please don't be afraid.
Livvie: Well, you can't make me hate him.
Michael: I can try.
Livvie: No, Caleb loved me. And now he's gone and my life is over.

Michael: This is just the beginning. You must realize that, Livvie. Throwing 
your whole life away over Caleb is a waste.

Livvie: No, I don't have to listen to this. I'm sick of everyone trying to 
poison me against him, and I'm definitely not listening to the person who killed 
him.
Michael: Killing my brother saved your life, so yes, you will listen to me.
Jack: Oh, man, I was afraid you wouldn't show.
Jamal: You're crazy, you know that? This is whacked.
Jack: Jamal, if you're not going to help me, then you can just take off.
Jamal: That's exactly why I'm here.
Jack: Well, let's do it. End all this, just like we talked about.
Jamal: You make it sound just so simple.
Jack: It is simple. If Livvie's going to be safe, I have to die.
[Captioning made possible

Karen: Alan is going to be here any minute. We've got to come up with 
something to tell him
Ian: We don't even know if he suspects anything.

Karen: Oh, trust me, when he said he wanted to see us, he did not sound 
happy.

Chris: All right, that's it. I for one am not going to stick around and find 
out bug Alan Quartermaine does or doesn't have up his -- hello, sir.
Alan: Zip it up, Ramsey.
Chris: Yes, sir.
Alan: I suppose you all know why I'm here.
Karen: Uh, no, actually, no.
Frank: No, not a clue.
Ian: That's funny, we were just discussing --
Alan: I just came from room 607.
Frank: 607. Gabby's room?

Alan: Yeah, Gabby's room. And there I found a security guard on the door with 
strict orders from you all that no one goes in or comes out. That includes 
nurses, doctors, and the chief of staff. Now, what makes it even stranger is 
that Gabby's name does not appear on the admittance record nor does she have any 
history of health problems. So needless to say, I need an explanation. Somebody 
better start talking and it damn well better be good.

Eve: Well, actually, it's true, Gabby was admitted, um, unofficially, but 
it's just that --
Alan: Just that what?
Eve: Well, we -- we, uh -- it happened so fast that we --

Ian: I'm not going to lie to you, Alan. You've been a good friend to me and 
I'm going to tell you the truth. And I need you to trust me, trust us. It's not 
going to be easy.
Livvie: Let go of me. You are a murder.

Michael: I don't care what you think of me, but you will know the truth about 
Caleb.

Livvie: No, there's nothing that you can say that'll change anything. I loved 
him and I always will.
Michael: You didn't even know him.

Livvie: No, I knew everything. But all that mattered is that he was a 
wonderful man who offered me the most incredible life, eternal life and eternal 
love. He told me that I'd never --

Michael: Never want for anything? That you were the family that could never 
be broken? Never feel helpless or lost or hurt again?
Livvie: How did you know that?

Michael: Because it's the same thing he told to Olivia. You remember her? The 
woman he loved before you? The woman he never stopped loving? Not since the day 
he took her life.
Livvie: No.

Michael: Don't you see, Livvie, that your dreams are just Caleb's dreams, and 
those are dreams he shared with another?
Livvie: No, that's not true.

Michael: No? Then tell me, when was the last time you thought for yourself or 
you felt an emotion or a desire that wasn't put there by Caleb's voice in your 
head? He controlled you, Livvie.
Livvie: No.
Michael: He manipulated you.
Livvie: No. No, you're lying. He wouldn't do that to me.

Michael: You were just a substitution, a replacement for the love he had 
before and lost.
Livvie: No. I was his love. It was me.

Michael: It was never you, Livvie. Caleb told me himself. You were just there 
to fill a void left by someone you so resemble and right the wrong of what he 
had done to her, as if that was somehow possible.
Livvie: God. I don't believe this.

Michael: You were lied to and used by a man who thought nothing of destroying 
your life. But it's not too late, Livvie. You have to get rid of Caleb. You have 
to expel him from your heart and your mind and reclaim the life that he has 
taken from you.
Livvie: Oh, God. What have I done?
Jamal: I am not driving a stake through your heart.

Jack: I'm not asking you, I'm telling you. Livvie's life's in danger as long 
as I'm alive.

Jamal: Jack, listen to me -- ok, we're trying to find a way to help you. Ok, 
Eve, Ian, and the rest of them -- they're working around the clock on this 
thing, bro.
Jack: Well, they're wasting their time.

Jamal: Oh, don't give me that. My sister almost died from this. Ok? They will 
find an answer.

Jack: Oh, and then what, huh? What if they do find an answer and I become 
normal again? How do you know I'm going to stay that way? Huh, Jamal? How do you 
know that someday I'm not going to see Livvie and I'm not going to get these 
same hunger pains that go on inside of me? How do you know that?
Jamal: You don't know. You just have to believe and trust.

Jack: Well, that's not good enough. There's only one way to keep Livvie safe, 
and we both know what that is.
Jamal: Sorry. I'm not buying it.
Jack: What about Caleb? His own brother couldn't even control him.
Jamal: Caleb? Caleb? Caleb was a monster.

Jack: A monster's what he became. Jamal, it wasn't the kind of life he 
wanted.
Jamal: What, so, what, you're defending him now?

Jack: Listen to me -- it's what Michael told me. Caleb tried to fight it, he 
tried to fight it hard, but the urge was too strong.
Jamal: Come on, man, that's not going to happen to you, Jack.

Jack: No, wake up, man! Reality is that if I live, I'm going to become what 
he is! And -- no. That's not going to happen, Jamal. Not if you care about me 
and not if you care about Livvie.

Jack: Come on, Jamal. I've always been able to count on you. You have to do 
this. You can't let me down, not now.
Jamal: I can't. I can't kill you, bro.

Jamal: But I will stand by you, all right? Look, I'm going to help you do 
this, all right, but you got to help me, too. You know, you got to keep hanging 
in there and not give up, all right? And you know what's got you so stressed, 
right, is you're hungry. I mean, you know how you are when you get low on the 
juice. I mean, you get week and you lose your fight, but, look, I'm going to fix 
you all up, I'm going to take care of you, get you back to yourself in no time.
Jack: No. No. I'll -- I'll get it myself.
Jamal: You sure.
Jack: Yeah, you're right. I'll feel a lot better once I get my strength up.
Jamal: Yeah, now you're talking some sense.
Jack: Yeah. Hey, thanks for putting up with me.
Jamal: Hey, it's nothing you wouldn't have done for me.
Jack: You're a great friend, man. The best I ever had. Thanks for that.
Jamal: Yeah, you, too.

Jamal: Hey, what's up? I thought you were going to the shop to get some 
dinner.
Jack: I, uh -- I am. I'm just going to go tell Livvie bye.

Michael: It's not in your heart, Livvie, to be what he was or even be part of 
his world.
Livvie: But he made the world sound so wonderful, so amazing.

Michael: While all the while knowing the truth -- that it is a cursed and 
miserable existence. You must see that, knowing how desperate and unhappy he 
truly was. I understand you wanting to believe in him. Anyone would've been 
tempted. And temptation is a powerful thing. I've felt it myself. But the reason 
I'm here and Caleb isn't is because I stayed strong and I resisted, and you are 
strong, too. Look at me. You just need to keep telling yourself -- telling 
yourself that you are better off without him, that you are better off with the 
friends and family that God has given to you. Promise me you'll hang on to this 
and hang on to the dreams that you had before Caleb. You do remember, don't you, 
Livvie? You remember what you wanted before Caleb?
Livvie: I wanted Jack.
Lucy: Whoa. Yep. This is the place.

Kevin: Yeah, nice to know Count Dracula's alive and well and living in 
Transylvania.
Lucy: Ooh, this is no time to joke.
Kevin: You're right, it's the time to go back to the car. Come on.
Lucy: No, no, wait, Doc. I am getting the most interesting vibe here.
Kevin: No kidding. Let's go.

Lucy: No. Wait, I know the vibe would be much more interesting inside the 
house. Let me try.
[Lucy gasps]
[door creaks]
Lucy: Whoa! Hello? Yoo-hoo? Anybody home? Hello? Hello?
Kevin: Nope. Let's go.
Lucy: Would you stop with that "let's go" stuff? You're like a broken record.
Kevin: Lucy, if there's no one home here --
Lucy: Well, but maybe someone's home, maybe someone's in the back.
Kevin: In the middle of the night?

Lucy: Ok. Maybe they're having a midnight snack in the kitchen or the 
conservatory.
Kevin: [As Dracula] Or maybe the torture chamber.

Lucy: Would you stop? Hello? Hello? It's Lucy Coe! You invited me here! It 
was a swell invitation! Hello? It's very quiet, isn't it?
Kevin: [Normal voice] Because no one is home.
Lucy: Would you stop? Someone is here. Doc, I can feel it. Really.
Kevin: What are you doing?

Lucy: The runes. I just want to lay a few out. It might help make sense of 
this place for me.

Kevin: Lucy, you know those old horror films where you yell at the screen, 
"Don't go in there?" I feel like I'm living in one right now.
Lucy: Uh-oh.
Kevin: What?

Lucy: Oh, Doc, you know when I said your -- your record was broken? Well, 
guess what -- your broken record -- it's not broken. We got to get out of here 
now. Let's go. Go, go, go, go! What? My God.
Ian: So as unbelievable as it may sound, it's the real story.
Karen: Now you know everything.
Eve: Alan?
Frank: Aren't you going to say anything?
Chris: You have any questions?
Alan: Where would I begin?

Ian: I understand you're skeptical, but you're going to have to say something 
here.

Chris: We have proof, at least where Gabby's concerned. Here's here blood 
work. It's unlike anything you've ever seen.
Eve: Or anything of this earth.
Ian: Alan, you got to say something.
Alan: All of you go back to work. This conversation never took place.
Nurse: Dr. Quartermaine. I was just looking for you.
Alan: What is it, Sara?
Sara: Should we take security off Gabriela now?
Alan: No, move her to the eighth floor lockup and double the security.
Sara: What?
Alan: Nobody gets in to see her except for the residents. Is that understood?
Michael: You must be Jamal.
Jamal: Yeah, I heard a lot about you.
Michael: Father Michael. You probably heard a lot me and my brother both.
Jamal: Yeah. Yeah.
Michael: I'm truly sorry for the trouble he has caused you all.
Jamal: Yeah, well, looks the worst is all behind us now, so --

Michael: I was just talking to Livvie. Looks like she's going to be all 
right.

Jamal: Oh, that's great. I just hope Jack buys it because a minute ago he was 
ready to off himself. It was -- it was pretty nuts.

Michael: What Jack's going through right now -- I don't think it's possible 
for any of us to imagine the fear he lives with every day, knowing the suffering 
he could bring to those he loves the most.
Jamal: So what's the answer, Father? How does he deal?

Michael: I'm afraid there's no easy answer, Jamal. Your friend's facing some 
complicated choices, and unfortunately there's not many options.
Livvie: Jack. I know you must hate me.
Jack: No, Livvie.

Livvie: But, Jack, I've got something to tell you. I've accepted that Caleb 
is gone now, and I'm ready to move on.
Jack: I'm glad.

Livvie: Jack, listen to me, Michael told me the truth about everything -- 
everything that you tried to tell me. He told me that Caleb was using me and 
that nothing was real. And he also said that I should try and remember what it 
was like before all this happened, Jack, what it was like between us.

Jack: So, you realized that Caleb was going to screw you over. So you came 
running back to me, is that it?
Livvie: No. Jack, that's not it at all.

Jack: It's too late, Livvie. You were right the first time -- there's no 
going back. The best thing for us is just to go our separate ways.
Livvie: What do you mean, "separate ways?"
Jack: I'm leaving Port Charles.
Livvie: No, Jack, don't do this! I need you!
Jack: Did you just decide that? Well, too late.

Livvie: No, Jack! Jack, listen to me, I see everything now. I have to get 
over this hold that Caleb still has on me and you are the only one that can do 
that for me, please!
Jack: Look, I can't, Livvie.
Livvie: What do you mean you can't? Jack, don't you still love me?

Jack: Love you? After everything you said? After everything you've done? No! 
I don't love you. Not anymore.
Livvie: No.

Jack: Stop. I said I don't love you anymore. Do you hear me? Do you get that? 
I don't love you anymore! It's over. We're over.
Livvie: No.
Jack: I'm sorry.
Livvie: No. Jack, no.
Jack: [whispers] Have a nice life, Livvie. I'll always love you.
Lucy: Somebody get us out of here!
Kevin: Lucy --
Lucy: Help! Help!
Kevin: Lucy!
Lucy: What?
Kevin: Don't panic, please.
Lucy: Too late. Help!

Kevin: Lucy, Lucy, I will get the door open. I'm sure it's just stuck, all 
right?
Lucy: Ok. Ooh!
Kevin: Thunder. Just thunder.

Lucy: Right. Right. Ok, so I -- you get the door, I'll just be waiting over 
here.
Kevin: Good idea.
Lucy: Good idea.
Man: Welcome, Ms. Coe. I've been expecting you.
>> On the next "Port Charles" --

Man: The chances are if you leave this house now, it's unlikely you'll ever 
arrive home.
Jamal: I think Jack went somewhere to die.
Jack: This is going to be the last place you'll see.
[Captioned by the National Captioning Institute]
